conversation.content: [laugh histerically] You seriously think I'm going to apologize after what you did?
Uh, no, I don't expect anything from you anymore. You've made it pretty clear where we stand, and honestly, I'm done pretending this is, like, salvageable or whatever.
So that's it? Just done?
Yeah, that's it. I mean, what else is there to say? You screwed me over, I'm moving on, end of story—no dramatic speeches necessary.
You're being really cold about this.
Cold? Hmm, okay, sure, if that's what you want to call it. I prefer to think of it as, uh, practical—wasting energy on dead relationships isn't really my thing anymore.
We were together for three years.
Right, and? Three years of, frankly, me giving way more than I got back. The math doesn't work out in your favor here, so spare me the nostalgia trip.
[mumbling] I thought you'd at least want to talk it through.
[cough] Talk through what exactly? How you lied about the promotion, or how you threw me under the bus with Sarah? Gosh, those conversations sound super productive.
[very loudly] I was trying to protect you!
Protect me. That's rich. You were protecting yourself and we both know it, so let's just, uhh, skip the revisionist history, yeah?
You never even gave me a chance to explain.
Mmm, because I don't need explanations for things I saw with my own eyes. The email thread was pretty self-explanatory, wouldn't you say?
Those emails were taken out of context.
Context. Right. See, the thing about context is it doesn't really change "I don't think she's ready for this" into something supportive, does it?
[deep pitch] Fine. Be bitter. See where that gets you.
Oh, I'm not bitter, I'm just... done. There's a difference, you know? Bitter implies I still care enough to be angry.
So you don't care at all?
Honestly? Not really, no. I've got actual problems to deal with now, and rehashing your, uh, inadequacies isn't on my priority list anymore—sorry if that stings.
